1) Choose teams: combinations (unordered, no repeats) - Search tag in package org.loudouncodes.combinatorics
Section
CartesianProduct - Class in org.loudouncodes.combinatorics
Generates the Cartesian product of multiple domains, each defined by its size, and exposes the tuples via Java's enhanced for loop by implementing Iterable<int[]>.
CartesianProduct(int...) - Constructor for class org.loudouncodes.combinatorics.CartesianProduct
Constructs a Cartesian product generator.
Combinations - Class in org.loudouncodes.combinatorics
Generates all k-combinations (unordered, without repetition) from the integer domain {0, 1, ..., n-1} in lexicographic order and exposes them via Java's enhanced for loop by implementing Iterable<int[]>.
Combinations(int, int) - Constructor for class org.loudouncodes.combinatorics.Combinations
Constructs a generator of k-combinations from {0..n-1}.
CombinationsWithRepetition - Class in org.loudouncodes.combinatorics
Generates all k-combinations with repetition (a.k.a.
CombinationsWithRepetition(int, int) - Constructor for class org.loudouncodes.combinatorics.CombinationsWithRepetition
Constructs a generator of k-combinations with repetition from {0..n-1}.

I

IndexingAdapter<E> - Class in org.loudouncodes.combinatorics
Adapts an Iterable<int[]> of index tuples to an Iterable<List<E>> of element tuples, using a provided List<E> as the backing source.
IndexingAdapter(Iterable<int[]>, List<E>) - Constructor for class org.loudouncodes.combinatorics.IndexingAdapter
Creates an adapter that maps index tuples from tuples to element tuples from source.
iterator() - Method in class org.loudouncodes.combinatorics.CartesianProduct
 
iterator() - Method in class org.loudouncodes.combinatorics.Combinations
Returns a fresh iterator positioned at the first combination [0,1,...,k-1] (or the empty array if k == 0).
iterator() - Method in class org.loudouncodes.combinatorics.CombinationsWithRepetition
Returns a fresh iterator positioned at the first non-decreasing tuple [0,0,...,0] (or the empty array if k == 0).
iterator() - Method in class org.loudouncodes.combinatorics.Derangements
Returns a fresh iterator that enumerates all derangements in lexicographic order.
iterator() - Method in class org.loudouncodes.combinatorics.IndexingAdapter
Returns an iterator that lazily maps each int[] to an unmodifiable List<E>.
iterator() - Method in class org.loudouncodes.combinatorics.Permutations
Returns a fresh iterator positioned at the first tuple [0,1,...,k-1] (or the empty array if k == 0).

org.loudouncodes.combinatorics - package org.loudouncodes.combinatorics
A tiny, classroom-friendly library for generating common combinatorial objects you can iterate with Java's enhanced for-loop.

Performance notes - Search tag in package org.loudouncodes.combinatorics

Permutations - Class in org.loudouncodes.combinatorics
Generates ordered k-permutations (k-tuples without repetition) drawn from the integer domain {0, 1, ..., n-1} and exposes them via Java's enhanced for loop by implementing Iterable<int[]>.
Permutations(int, int) - Constructor for class org.loudouncodes.combinatorics.Permutations
Constructs a generator of ordered k-permutations from {0..n-1}.

S

3) Secret-Santa style: derangements (no fixed points) - Search tag in package org.loudouncodes.combinatorics
Section
size() - Method in class org.loudouncodes.combinatorics.CartesianProduct
Returns the total number of tuples in the Cartesian product.
size() - Method in class org.loudouncodes.combinatorics.Combinations
Returns the total number of k-combinations of n items (the binomial coefficient).
size() - Method in class org.loudouncodes.combinatorics.CombinationsWithRepetition
Returns the total number of k-combinations with repetition of n items.
size() - Method in class org.loudouncodes.combinatorics.Derangements
Returns the total number of derangements !n using the standard recurrence: !0 = 1, !1 = 0, !n = (n-1)(!(n-1)+!(n-2)).
size() - Method in class org.loudouncodes.combinatorics.Permutations
Returns the total number of ordered k-permutations (falling factorial nPk).
